verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. The king <WH4428> shall joy <WH8055> <WH8799> in thy strength <WH5797>, O YY <WH3068>; and in thy salvation <WH3444> how greatly <WH3966> shall he rejoice <WH1523> <WH8799> !
Thou hast given <WH5414> <WH8804> him his heart's <WH3820> desire <WH8378>, and hast not withholden <WH4513> <WH8804> the request <WH782> of his lips <WH8193>. Selah <WH5542>.
For thou preventest <WH6923> <WH8762> him with the b'rakhot <WH1293> of goodness <WH2896>: thou settest <WH7896> <WH8799> a crown <WH5850> of pure gold <WH6337> on his head <WH7218>.
He asked <WH7592> <WH8804> life <WH2416> of thee, and thou gavest <WH5414> <WH8804> it him, even length <WH753> of days <WH3117> for ever <WH5769> and ever <WH5703>.
His glory <WH3519> is great <WH1419> in thy salvation <WH3444>: honour <WH1935> and majesty <WH1926> hast thou laid <WH7737> <WH8762> upon him.
For thou hast made <WH7896> <WH8799> him most blessed <WH1293> for ever <WH5703>: thou hast made <WH2302> <WH8762> him exceeding glad <WH8057> with thy countenance <WH6440>.
For the king <WH4428> trusteth <WH982> <WH8802> in the YY <WH3068>, and through the mercy <WH2617> of Ha `Elyon <WH5945> he shall not be moved <WH4131> <WH8735>.
Thine hand <WH3027> shall find out <WH4672> <WH8799> all thine enemies <WH341> <WH8802>: thy right hand <WH3225> shall find out <WH4672> <WH8799> those that hate <WH8130> <WH8802> thee.

Thou shalt make <WH7896> <WH8799> them as a fiery <WH784> oven <WH8574> in the time <WH6256> of thine anger <WH6440>: the YY <WH3068> shall swallow them up <WH1104> <WH8762> in his wrath <WH639>, and the fire <WH784> shall devour <WH398> <WH8799> them.
Their fruit <WH6529> shalt thou destroy <WH6> <WH8762> from the earth <WH776>, and their seed <WH2233> from among the children <WH1121> of men <WH120>.
For they intended <WH5186> <WH8804> evil <WH7451> against thee: they imagined <WH2803> <WH8804> a mischievous device <WH4209>, which they are not able <WH3201> <WH8799> to perform.
Therefore shalt thou make <WH7896> <WH8799> them turn their back <WH7926>, when thou shalt make ready <WH3559> <WH8787> thine arrows upon thy strings <WH4340> against the face <WH6440> of them.
Be thou exalted <WH7311> <WH8798>, YY <WH3068>, in thine own strength <WH5797>: so will we sing <WH7891> <WH8799> and praise <WH2167> <WH8762> thy power <WH1369>.
